Label: LABEL
Definition: A skos:definition

Label: ID range for this spredsheet is PMD_0010000 - PMD_0011000
NEEDS TO BE ADDED TO PMDco
corrosion resistant
Definition: a disposition to withstand corrosive attack to a certain extend

Label: hardenable
Definition: a disposition to gain a greatly increased hardness at the surface or entire volume by the process of hardening

Label: containing magnetic species
Definition: A disposition that inheres in a material entity in virtue of the presence of one or more magnetic species (e.g. ferromagnetic, paramagnetic, or diamagnetic particles or atoms), and that manifests under appropriate conditions as the ability of that material entity to exhibit a magnetic response or influence in a magnetic field.

Label: bioactive
Definition: A disposition that inheres in a material entity and is realized in an organismal context as a specific interaction with one or more biological systems, producing a measurable biological effect (e.g., therapeutic, toxic, or signaling outcome).

Label: alloy crystal
Definition: a crystal whose atomic entities have metallic bond

Label: ceramic crystal
Definition: a crystal whose atomic entities have a ionic or a covalent bond

Label: semiconductor
Definition: band gap >xx eV

Label: carbon steel
Definition: ferrous metal that has a limited amout of carbon

Label: stainless steel
Definition: stainless steel is an iron-based alloy that contains chromium, making it resistant to corrosion (rust).

Label: ferrous metal
Definition: metal that has iron as primary constituent

Label: cast iron
Definition: ferrous metal that has an amout of min 2.07 wt % carbon

Label: alloy
Definition: a metallic alloy is a mixture of chemical elements of which at least one is a metallic element

Label: chromium steel
Definition: chromium steel is the name for any one of a class of non-stainless steels which are used for applications such as bearings, tools, drills and utensils. Such as stainless steel, chromium steels contain chromium, but do not have the corrosion-resistant properties of stainless steel.

Label: tool steel
Definition: steel with tailored mechanical properties

Label: alloy steel
Definition: alloy steel is steel that is alloyed with a variety of elements in amounts between 1.0% and 50% by weight, typically to improve its mechanical properties.

Label: non-ferrous metal
Definition: non-ferrous metals are metals or alloys that do not contain iron (allotropes of iron, ferrite, and so on) in appreciable amounts.

Label: aluminium alloy
Definition: non-ferrous metal consisting primarily of aluminium mixed with other elements

Label: copper alloy
Definition: non-ferrous metal consisting primarily of copper combined with other elements

Label: titanium alloy
Definition: non-ferrous metal consisting primarily of titanium combined with other elements

Label: nickel alloy
Definition: non-ferrous metal consisting primarily of nickel combined with other elements

Label: zinc alloy
Definition: non-ferrous metal consisting primarily of zinc combined with other elements

Label: precious metal
Definition: metal that are rare, naturally occurring, and have high economic value due to their resistance to corrosion, oxidation, and chemical reaction

Label: gold metal
Definition: precious metal consisting primarily of gold

Label: silver metal
Definition: precious metal consisting primarily of silver

Label: platinum metal
Definition: precious metal consisting primarily of platinum

Label: palladium metal
Definition: precious metal consisting primarily of palladium

Label: rhodium metal
Definition: precious metal consisting primarily of rhodium

Label: silicate glasses
Definition: Silicate glasses are glasses whose network is based primarily on silica (SiO₂), typically with additional components (e.g., alumina, soda, lime, boron oxide, etc.) added to tailor properties.

Label: soda-lime glass
Definition: Soda‑lime glass is a silicate glass that is composed of about 70% silica (SiO₂) with soda (Na₂O) acting as a flux and lime (CaO) acting as a stabilizer, and is widely used as common window and container glass.
additional classes: ('has part' some 'portion of sodium' or ('has part' some 'portion of calcium'))

Label: borosilicate glass
Definition: Borosilicate glass is a silicate glass that uses boron trioxide (B₂O₃) as a major additional glass‑forming constituent alongside silica, giving it characteristically low thermal expansion and high thermal/chemical resistance compared with soda‑lime glass.

Label: fused silica glass
Definition: Fused silica is a silicate glass that is essentially pure, amorphous SiO₂ (often called fused quartz or vitreous silica), obtained by melting silica and cooling fast enough to avoid crystallization.

Label: lead glass
Definition: Lead glass is a silicate glass in which lead(II) oxide (PbO) is incorporated in significant amounts, increasing refractive index and modifying working properties relative to ordinary silicate glasses.

Label: aluminosilicate glass
Definition: Aluminosilicate glass is a silicate glass in which SiO₂ and Al₂O₃ are key structural units, typically enabling higher transformation/softening temperatures and improved mechanical/chemical performance compared with many common silicates.

Label: non-silicate glasses
Definition: Non‑silicate glasses are glasses whose primary glass‑forming network is not based on SiO₂, but instead on other glass formers or non‑oxide systems (e.g., phosphate (P₂O₅)-based, fluoride-based, or chalcogenide (S/Se/Te)-based compositions).

Label: phosphate glass
Definition: Phosphate glass is a non‑silicate glass based primarily on phosphorus pentoxide (P₂O₅) as the glass former (i.e., replacing SiO₂ as the network basis).

Label: borate glass
Definition: Borate glass is a non‑silicate glass based primarily on boron oxide (B₂O₃) as the glass‑forming network; it is distinct from borosilicate glass because B₂O₃ is the primary network former here rather than an added co‑former in a silica‑based network.

Label: chalcogenide glass
Definition: Chalcogenide glass is a non‑silicate glass (generally non‑oxide) that contains one or more chalcogens such as sulfur, selenium, or tellurium as key constituents and is valued particularly for infrared transparency.
additional classes: ('has part' some 'portion of selenium' or ('has part' some 'portion of tellurium'))

Label: fluoride glass
Definition: Fluoride glass is a non‑silicate glass made from metal fluorides (a non‑oxide glass family), often used for photonics because certain compositions offer good infrared transmission and low phonon energies.

Label: specialty glasses
Definition: Specialty glasses are glasses engineered primarily for a targeted functional performance profile (e.g., optical functionality, magneto‑optical response, bioactivity, radiation shielding, or controlled crystallization), typically chosen to deliver a distinctive “property portfolio” for consumer and specialized markets.

Label: optical glass
Definition: Optical glass is a specialty glass manufactured for optical components (e.g., lenses, prisms, mirrors) with composition and processing chosen to achieve specified optical/mechanical parameters such as refractive index and dispersion.

Label: magnetic glass
Definition: Magnetic glass is a specialty glass that exhibits intrinsic bulk magnetic behavior (e.g., paramagnetism, ferri/ferromagnetism, superparamagnetism, or spin‑glass freezing) because its composition and/or microstructure contains a significant population of magnetic species - typically transition‑metal or rare‑earth ions and/or magnetic nanophases - so that magnetic susceptibility/permeability/magnetization is a designed functional property of the glass.

Label: glass-ceramics
Definition: Glass‑ceramics are inorganic, non‑metallic materials prepared by controlled crystallization of glasses via different processing methods; they contain at least one type of functional crystalline phase and a residual glass, and the crystallized volume fraction may vary from ppm to almost 100%.

Label: bioactive glass
Definition: Bioactive glass is a specialty glass that forms a biologically compatible hydroxycarbonate apatite (HCA) layer on its surface in physiological conditions, enabling bonding with bone tissue.

Label: radiation shielding glass
Definition: Radiation shielding glass is a specialty glass formulated with heavy elements (commonly lead and/or barium-containing compositions) to provide transparent attenuation of X‑rays (and, depending on design, gamma radiation).

Label: oxide ceramic
Definition: ceramic consisting primarily of metal oxide

Label: alumina
Definition: oxide ceramic consisting primarily of aluminium oxide

Label: zirconia
Definition: oxide ceramic consisting primarily of zirconium oxide

Label: silica
Definition: oxide ceramic consisting primarily of silicon oxide

Label: magnesia
Definition: oxide ceramic consisting primarily of magnesium oxide

Label: non-oxide ceramic
Definition: ceramic consisting primarily of non-oxide elements

Label: carbide
Definition: non-oxide ceramic consisting of a metal and carbon

Label: silicon carbide
Definition: carbide with silicon

Label: tungsten carbide
Definition: carbide with tungsten

Label: nitride
Definition: non-oxide ceramic consisting of a metal and nitrogen

Label: silicon nitride
Definition: nitritde with silicon

Label: boron nitride
Definition: nitritde with boron

Label: boride
Definition: non-oxide ceramic consisting of a boron and another element

Label: silicide
Definition: non-oxide ceramic consisting of a silicon and another element

Label: composite ceramic
Definition: a composite with at least part being a ceramic material
additional classes: ('has part' some ('material' and 'has role' some 'matrix role') and 'has part' some ('material' and 'has role' some 'filler role'))

Label: cermet
Definition: a metal matrix with ceramic filler
additional classes: ('has part' some ('metal' and 'has role' some 'matrix role') and 'has part' some ('ceramic' and 'has role' some 'filler role'))

Label: ceramic matrix composite
Definition: a ceramic matrix with a (metal) filler
additional classes: ('has part' some ('ceramic' and 'has role' some 'matrix role') and 'has part' some ('material' and 'has role' some 'filler role'))

Label: porcelain
Definition: a glass binder with ceramic filler produced from ceramics
additional classes: ('has part' some ('glass' and 'has role' some 'matrix role') and 'has part' some ('ceramic' and 'has role' some 'filler role'))

Label: glass-ceramic
Definition: a glass binder with ceramic filler produced from glass
additional classes: ('has part' some ('glass' and 'has role' some 'matrix role') and 'has part' some ('ceramic' and 'has role' some 'filler role'))
